main event: Two blips size of pin-head were observed in stacked formation with rapid changes in altitude at Fallon AFS.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 1 hour and 21 minutes., The objects were observed at 60,000 feet altitude and changed altitude rapidly., The motion was erratic, with the objects disappearing and reappearing approximately once a minute., An extreme temperature inversion was suggested as a possible cause for the observed phenomena., Equipment malfunction was ruled out due to the length of the observation time.
